explanation: showing in your behavior that you are anxious and nervous
sentence: She became very agitated when her son failed to return home.
sentence_gap: She became very ________ when her son failed to return home.

sentence: To my amazement, he ate the whole pie.
sentence_gap: To my _________, he ate the whole pie.

sentence: His letter bespeaks his willingness to help.
sentence_gap: His letter ________ his willingness to help.

explanation: a small, narrow opening in something solid
sentence: There were small plants growing in every nook and cranny of the wall.
sentence_gap: There were small plants growing in every nook and ______ of the wall.

explanation: (something with) a curved shape that has two narrow pointed ends, like the moon when it is less than half of a circle
sentence: The moon was a brightly shining crescent.
sentence_gap: The moon was a brightly shining ________.

explanation: formal; to remove one or all of the organs from the inside of a body
sentence: Each mouse carcass was skinned, eviscerated and digested.
sentence_gap: Each mouse carcass was skinned, ___________ and digested.

translated: rozwodzić się nad czymś, rozwlekać się
explanation: formal disapproving; to speak or write about something in great detail or for a long time
sentence: She expatiated on her work for the duration of the meal.
sentence_gap: She __________ on her work for the duration of the meal.

explanation: extremely brave and showing no fear of dangerous situations
sentence: Intrepid travelers can stay the night at Volcano House, located along the rim of Kilauea.
sentence_gap: ________ travelers can stay the night at Volcano House, located along the rim of Kilauea.

explanation: a situation of confusion or bad organization
sentence: There was a big muddle over who was buying the tickets.
sentence_gap: There was a big ______ over who was buying the tickets.

explanation: formal; (also used following the noun it refers to) without being affected by something; despite something
sentence: Notwithstanding some major financial problems, the school has had a successful year.
sentence_gap: _______________ some major financial problems, the school has had a successful year.

explanation: a serious disagreement between people that stops their relationship from continuing; a large crack or opening in the ground, rocks, or clouds
sentence: The stream had cut a deep rift in the rock. The marriage caused a rift between the brothers and they didn't speak to each other for ten years.
sentence_gap: The stream had cut a deep ____ in the rock. The marriage caused a ____ between the brothers and they didn't speak to each other for ten years.

explanation: to breathe in quickly and repeatedly through the nose, usually because you are crying or because you have a cold
sentence: He was snuffling and blowing his nose.
sentence_gap: He was _________ and blowing his nose.

explanation: to make fingers, legs, etc. become further apart from each other or spread out; to be spread out wide apart
sentence: She lay on the bed, her arms and legs splayed out.
sentence_gap: She lay on the bed, her arms and legs _______ out.

explanation: a long thin mark or line that is a different color from the surface it is on
sentence: The window cleaner left dirty streaks on the windows.
sentence_gap: The window cleaner left dirty _______ on the windows.

explanation: calm and peaceful and without noise, violence, worry, etc.
sentence: She stared at the tranquil surface of the water.
sentence_gap: She stared at the ________ surface of the water.
